publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3473# Fiona McLeod: Report by the United Nations Committee on the Rights of the Child—That the Parliament notes the concluding observations by the UN Committee on the Rights of the Child on the UK’s implementation of the UN Convention on the Rights of the Child published on 4 October 2002 and considers that the Scottish Executive should bring forward measures to address the criticism within its devolved areas of competence and use its influence with Her Majesty’s Government in support of measures to alleviate distress to children in Scotland arising from reserved matters.Supported by: Robin Harper*
S1M-3473# Report by the United Nations Committee on the Rights of the Child (lodged on 8 October 2002) Ms Sandra White*
S1M-3473# Report by the United Nations Committee on the Rights of the Child (lodged on 8 October 2002) Tommy Sheridan*, Linda Fabiani*
S1M-3473# Report by the United Nations Committee on the Rights of the Child (lodged on 8 October 2002) Andrew Wilson*
S1M-3473# Report by the United Nations Committee on the Rights of the Child (lodged on 8 October 2002) Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*
S1M-3473# Report by the United Nations Committee on the Rights of the Child (lodged on 8 October 2002) Stewart Stevenson*, Scott Barrie*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*
S1M-3473# Report by the United Nations Committee on the Rights of the Child (lodged on 8 October 2002) Mr Lloyd Quinan*
S1M-3473# Report by the United Nations Committee on the Rights of the Child (lodged on 8 October 2002) Irene McGugan*
S1M-3473# Report by the United Nations Committee on the Rights of the Child (lodged on 8 October 2002) Dr Winnie Ewing*
